hanzi-su-wiki:
銭

Значения

Деньги

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Наименьшая доля 戔 золотой 金 монеты, 1100 иены, 1 сэн.

Варианты

錢, 钱
purpleculture_pinyin:
qián
Japanese variant of 钱
Японский вариант денег
rtega_mnemonic:
錢錢RS
钱钱		銭money, currency, coins
  • a small amount 戔/㦮 of gold or metal 金 serves as currency
  • metal 金 used to pay soldiers 戔/㦮
  • small 戋 metal 钅 coins are money
heisig_story: Those special gold-colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the floats give us the kanji for coins.
koohiiStory1: Political hopefuls in Rome threw gold COINS from floats when they were campaigning for office.
koohiiStory2: Interesting fact: The Japanese one yen coin is the only coin in the world that can float on water. http://www.hanamiweb.com/floatingyen.jpg.
jp_example_words:
小銭(こぜに): coins, small change
金銭(きんせん): money, cash
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A gold bar can be turned into a coin. Well, more than one coin, probably. But you know for sure that you can make at least one coin out of this gold bar.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine taking this gold bar and punching a coin out of it. Imagine yourself pulling a lever to press a coin out of the gold bar. Feel the lever going down as you hear the sound of a gold coin being punched out.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You need this coin to give to a centaur (せん). The centaur is your bodyguard and he only accepts gold coins as payment.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine paying this centaur with your gold coin. Hear the centaur thank you in his gruff voice before he gallops away.
Ru_Radicals: 丶 (капля), ノ, 毛 (шерсть), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) you use three spears (㦮) to get is money

銭
Name meaning
Nothing.
qián
яп. вм. 钱
Radicals: 金  (gold, bar)
Meaning Mnemonic
A gold bar can be turned into a coin. Well, more than one coin, probably. But you know for sure that you can make at least one coin out of this gold bar.
Imagine taking this gold bar and punching a coin out of it. Imagine yourself pulling a lever to press a coin out of the gold bar. Feel the lever going down as you hear the sound of a gold coin being punched out.
Reading Mnemonic
You need this coin to give to a centaur (せん). The centaur is your bodyguard and he only accepts gold coins as payment.
Imagine paying this centaur with your gold coin. Hear the centaur thank you in his gruff voice before he gallops away.
